p: Five compounds, neoandrographolide (-8.50 kcal/mol), isoandrographolide (− 8.30 kcal/mol), 14-deoxy-14,15-didehydroandrographolide (− 7.90 kcal/mol), 14-Deoxyandrographolide (− 7.80 kcal/mol) and 5-hydroxy-7, 8, 2′,5′-tetramethoxy flavone (− 7.80 kcal/mol) from A. paniculata, have shown better binding energy affinity compared to remdesivir (− 7.60 kcal/mol) (Table 1). Among these, neoandrographolide exhibited higher dock score of − 8.50 kcal/mol and interacted with ALA125, ASP126, ARG132 and HIS133 amino acid residues of RdRp through four hydrogen bonds (Table 2, Fig. 3).
